article.title: symmetry
article.p:
symmetry
, In geometry, the property by which the sides of a figure or object reflect each other across a line (axis of symmetry) or surface; in biology, the orderly repetition of parts of an animal or plant; in chemistry, a fundamental property of orderly arrangements of atoms in molecules or
crystals
; in physics, a concept of balance illustrated by such fundamental laws as the third of
Newton’s laws of motion
. Symmetry in nature underlies one of the most fundamental concepts of beauty. It connotes balance, order, and thus, to some, a type of divine principle.
